name: Alison Turnbull Exercise Book - All 4 Colours for £60
description:
Special offer on all 4 of the Alison Turnbull exhibition catalogue.

Colours are Blue, Yellow, Grey and Orange.

name: Alison Turnbull: Vitis Vinifera L. (Paperback)
description:
Vitis vinifera L. documents Alison Turnbull’s commission for One Vine Street, undertaken during 2008 as part of The Crown Estate’s redevelopment of the area.

This new, fully illustrated publication includes an essay by Paul Bonaventura which places the work in the wider context of the artist's research and studio practice.

name: Alison Turnbull Exercise Book (Exhibition Catalogue)
description:
24x30cm Catalogue to accompany the Alison Turnbull Exhibition here at the De La Warr Pavilion. 

Available in 4 different Colours.

name: Shaun Gladwell 'Cycles of Radical Will' (Hardback)
description:
'Cycles of Radical Will' is a new book by the Australian artist Sean Gladwell.

Featuring beautiful photographs of Sean's recent exhibition here at the De La Warr Pavilion, this book is an essential purchase for fans of both Sean's work, and the Pavilion itself.

name: New DLWP South Staircase Mug by Gerry Whale
De La Warr Pavilion Mug
description:
Commissioned from our friends at People Will Always Need Plates to commemorate the reopening in 2005.

Available in either Blue, Yellow or Green.

name: Richard Wilson Limited Edition Sculpture
description:
A Limited Edition of Richard Wilson’s Hang On A Minute Lads, I’ve Got A Great Idea… was launched at An Evening with Richard Wilson on 11 May.

The Limited Edition (of 30), are signed and numbered by the artist and are priced at £1800 (inc. VAT).

They are made of sprayed polyurethane resin and wood.

Please visit http://www.dlwp.com/news/2012/05/21/richard-wilson-limited-edition-sculpture for more information.

Collection Only.

name: De La Warr Pavilion Building Guide
description: 6 sided fold out history guide and plan of the De La Warr Pavilion.

name: De La Warr Pavilion: A Short History by Graham Whitham
description:
This book is a short history of the De La Warr Pavilion. Opened in 1935, the Pavilion is now Grade 1 listed for arguably being the most important Modernist public building in Great Britain. Why and how such a significant work of architecture was built in Bexhill on Sea is a fascinating story of economic necessity, aspiration and vision. 

Paperback 28 pages.

name: De La Warr Pavilion, The Modernist Masterpiece
description:
The story of the De La Warr Pavilion from inception to present date by author Alastair Fairley, includes stunning high gloss photographs and architectural plans.
 
The paperback is exclusive to dlwp.

name: Uniform Wares 100 Series Wristwatch
description:
The 103 model is a revised and re-engineered update of the incredibly popular 100 Series by British brand Uniform Wares. Designed in the UK to resemble British industrial wall clocks, the 103 model features a more durable case machined from aerospace-grade stainless steel – the same material used in their 200 and 300 Series watches.
 
The watch’s case, buckle and crown have been treated in the same colour with an ultra-matt PVD coating, giving the 100 Series a uniform aesthetic.

The 100 Series has been chosen for inclusion in San Francisco Museum of Modern Art’s Architecture + Design permanent collection.

name: X-Large Black Red Gloss Lightshade
description: Handspun aluminium lightshade - 730mm diameter. For use with standard UK light fitting (28mm). Wet spray paint finish by hand - gloss 'black red' outer & ultra flat matt white inner. Due to the handmade nature of the lightshades, delivery time can be up to 4 weeks. Postage and packaging cost to mainland UK is £40.00. For orders from outside the UK, please email info@restprojects.co.uk Made in England.

name: Five a Day Brooch: Grapes
description:
These quirky crocheted fruit & veg brooches are lovingly handmade at home by women from the Zoe project in Lima, Peru.  Perfect for putting a bit of extra colour into any outfit, or adorning a big, thick winter coat.

Working with Just Trade allows these women to earn a fair wage and work from home, meaning their children are not left unattended. 

Each brooch is made from crocheted cotton and comes on its own ‘Cinco al Dia’ presentation card.

description:
These quirky crocheted fruit & veg brooches are lovingly handmade at home by women from the Zoe project in Lima, Peru.  Perfect for putting a bit of extra colour into any outfit, or adorning a big, thick winter coat.

name: Time-M Matryoshka Kitchen Timer
description:
Add a dash of retro flair to your contemporary kitchen with our Time-M Matryoshka Kitchen Timer!  Give this charming nested matryoshka doll a twist and she'll happily tell you when the babka is toasty hot and your tea is brewed to perfection.  Go ahead and get her all wound up!  

Durable ivory plastic with a traditional wind-up "ding" timer.

Measures 4.25 inches tall.

name: BEERDEAUX Stemware:The Longneck Wineglass
description:
...atop a sleek, chic wine stem. So whether you''e sipping a Pale Ale or a Petite Syrah, Beerdeaux is just right. It's a glass for all occasions, hand-blown from crystal clear borosilicate glass. 


Weight: 0.4 lbs
Dimensions: 3.55 x 3.55 x 9.5 inches
Material: Glassware
Made In: China
Designed by: FRED Studio

name: De La Warr Pavilion Mosaic
description:
'Lizzie Wells Mosaics' created this mosaic with Bisazza's Opus Romano 12mm glass tiles. It measures approximately 1.7m x 1.2m and is comprised of approximately 12,500 tiles mounted onto 12mm MDF.  Its creation coincided with a major Andy Warhol retrospective at the De La Warr Pavilion in Bexhill in the winter of 2011/12.

If you wish to view this Mosaic it is located at the following address:

The Mosaic Gallery
21 Endwell Road
Bexhill on Sea 
East Sussex
TN40 1EA
(Just by Bexhill station)

Please note that this item is collection only.

name: De La Warr Pavilion Plate
description:
For decoration only. 

size 27.5cm

name: De La Warr Pavilion Magnet
description: 8cm x 5.5cm

description:
2012

Digital print on archival paper

60cm x 43cm

name: Cerith Wyn Evans Collage
description:
Collage for the De La Warr Pavilion 2012.

Framed.

82cm x 64cm

1 of 1 

Collection Only.

name: DLWP Tea Towel
description:
The original exclusive DLWP tea towel.
 
People Will Always Need Plates is the creation of Hannah Dipper, an RCA ceramist, and Robin Farquhar, a Brunel Industrial Design graduate.

Launched in 2004, they aim to use high quality, low volume batch production to create witty, thoughtful and stylish products as a direct antithesis to the current proliferation of cheap, throwaway design.

In keeping with their credo that good design should be used and enjoyed, treasured and shared, Hannah and Robin try to develop products that, while diverse in style and application, always retain the fundamental values of functionality and beauty.

name: Bridget Smith
description:
This Guide Features a chance to see the work of Bridget Smith who was the photographer commisioned by the De La Warr Pavilion during the refurbishment and restoration.

Paperback: 150 pages

name: Hang On A Minute Lads, I've Got A Great Idea Print
description:
Digital print on archival paper

81cm x 101cm

Artist proof 

Edition of 20 

Signed 

Framed prints are for collection only.

name: The Universal Addressability of Dumb Things Catalogue
description:
Curated by Turner Prize-winning artist Mark Leckey, The Universal Addressability of Dumb Things explores the theme of "techno-animism," whereby the inanimate comes to life through technology. Leckey juxtaposes contemporary art with machines, archeological objects and historical documents.

This is the Official Exhibition Catalogue to accompany the show.

name: Andy Warhol Brillo Box (Limited Edition)
description:
Savings box, aluminum, with ingenious opening device, in ANDY WARHOL-Design "BRILLO BOX" limited edition 3.000 pcs

Design: Motiv: Andy Warhol
Measure: 80 * 80 * 80 mm
Weight: 370 Gramm

name: Buddha Butter Dish
description:
I can't believe it's not Buddha!

It's impossible to be in perfect harmony with all living things if you're worried about keeping a stick of butter fresh. Hopon the delicious path to enlightenment with the Buddha Butter Dish.

This ceramic butter shrine will bring luck to the table morning, noon and night while helping you grow a Buddha belly of your own.

name: Freakeys
description:
Brightly coloured monsters with wibbly-wobbly arms that decorate your keys and brighten up your keyring.

Just pull them over the end of your key and watch them wiggle when you shake them. There are six Freakeys in a pack, each one different and eye-catching.

name: Drink Savers Ice Tray
description: Fred and Friends Drink Savers life ring ice tray. Pure silicone ice tray packaged in a clear, peggable display box.

name: Holy Toast
description:
Press the Holy Toast bread stamp into any common slice of bread 
then toast it to behold a real-life miracle in your own home 
the image of our saviour appears in your breakfast. It's a miracle!

name: Pigeon Light
description:
by Ed Carpenter
 
An urban souvenir.

Wall-mounted light made from 3mm vacuum-formed Acrylic.


Max. 25W light bulb.

 21 × 20.5 × H23cm

name: Shed Hook by Domesticity
description:
The hooks that like to hold more than just coats. Shed is a highly functional coat hook, which is also designed to store items that you need when entering or leaving the house, such as keys, bags, mail and gloves.

Available in orange, white and grey.

Includes wall fixings.

Dimensions: 9.5 x 6.5 x 7 cm.

Material: Powder coated steel.

name: Special Edition DLWP Warhol Bag
description: Part of our People Will Always Need Plates Warhol inspired De La Warr Pavilion range.

name: Budget Cuts Piggy Bank
description: Store your coins in this ceramic, novelty piggy bank.

name: Crinkle Cup
description: They may look like crumpled throwaway coffee cups, but these mini-mugs come with a twist - they are actually ceramic!

name: Crinkle Glass
description: The Crinkle Glass is Dutch designer, Rob Brandt's follow up his ever popular Crinkle Cup. Made in Spain from recycled glass the Crinkle Glass is dishwasher safe.

name: Auditorium Calico Bag
description:
Auditorium ceiling inspired calico bag (manufactured in the UK) designed by people will always need plates for a spot of shopping!
 
People Will Always Need Plates is the creation of Hannah Dipper, an RCA ceramist, and Robin Farquhar, a Brunel Industrial Design graduate.

Launched in 2004, they aim to use high quality, low volume batch production to create witty, thoughtful and stylish products as a direct antithesis to the current proliferation of cheap, throwaway design.

In keeping with their credo that good design should be used and enjoyed, treasured and shared, Hannah and Robin try to develop products that, while diverse in style and application, always retain the fundamental values of functionality and beauty.
